text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Bosnian government expresses its concern after learning of some irregularities in the elections, especially in Serb entity, President Alija Izetbegovic says in statement after meeting with United States envoy Richard Holbrooke on Sunday.
- "The only thing missing in all this mess was the star of David on people's breasts", Muhamed Sacirbey, Bosnian ambassador to United Nations, says in comment about voting of Moslems in Serb entity.

- Enes Bezdrob, aide to Bosnian Federation interior minister, denies report from Robert Frowick, chief of OSCE mission in Bosnia, that 20,000 Bosnian Moslems crossed inter- entity boundary line and voted in Serb entity. He says that only 6,000 people did that.
